definitions: To begin a journey or trip.
To cause something to explode or activate.
To cause an alarm or warning to sound.
To make something more attractive or noticeable by contrast.
To compensate for something bad with something good.
examples: We set off early in the morning to avoid traffic.
The fireworks were set off at midnight.
The smoke detector was set off by the burnt toast.
The white frame sets off the painting beautifully.
His good humor sets off his occasional grumpiness.
